paper_abstract: This paper extends the scenario of the Four Color Theorem in the following way. Let be the set of all -uniform hypergraphs that can be (linearly) embedded into . We investigate lower and upper bounds on the maximum (weak) chromatic number of hypergraphs in . For example, we can prove that for there are hypergraphs in on vertices whose chromatic number is , whereas the chromatic number for -vertex hypergraphs in is bounded by for d >= 3.
